description: From Middle English inequalite, from Old French inequalité, from Medieval Latin inaequālitās, from Latin inaequālis (“unequal”), from in- (“not”) + aequālis (“equal”).

examples: The inequality in living standards led to a civil war as the have nots rebelled.

The inequality 
  
    
      
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle x}
  
 is less than 
  
    
      
        y
      
    
    {\displaystyle y}
  
, together with that 
  
    
      
        y
        <
        z
      
    
    {\displaystyle y<z}
  
, allows us to deduce the inequality 
  
    
      
        x
        <
        z
      
    
    {\displaystyle x<z}
  
.
